title: Canada extends MDA Space’s ISS robotics contract to 2030
summary: The Canadian Space Agency has awarded MDA Space a contract extension worth around $182 million to continue supporting robotics operations on the International Space Station until 2030.

title: The paradox of U.S. government R&D funding: Barriers for non-U.S. owned firms
summary: The U.S. government craves innovation but sets barriers via ownership stipulations, contrasting with other nations open to R&D funding with less stringent conditions.

title: FAA to require reentry vehicles licensed before launch
summary: The FAA is revising its licensing regulations to prevent a repeat of a situation last year where a spacecraft launched without approvals to return.

title: A reflection on Space Symposium
summary: The Space Symposium has been well known for decades as the world’s largest space gathering, bringing together brilliant minds from government, industry and academia to evaluate progress in space advancements.

title: The trillion-dollar question
summary: Forecasts from Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley and other heavyweight investment banks of a trillion-dollar space economy by 204 have echoed across the industry for more than half a decade.

title: The hidden story behind one of SpaceX’s wettest and wildest launches
summary: "It looked like a giant smoke monster."

title: Nelson defends “very tough choices” in NASA’s budget proposal
summary: NASA Administrator Bill Nelson defended the agency’s plans to cut back or cancel some agency programs at a House hearing, placing much of the blame at the feet of Congress.

title: Nelson Defends Tough Choices in FY2025 Budget Request
summary: NASA Administrator Bill Nelson fielded questions from House Appropriations committee members today about why the FY2025 budget request includes cuts to programs in some of their districts. The answer was […]

title: Ingenuity – Down, But Not Out
summary: NASA’s intrepid Mars helicopter, Ingenuity, sent its last transmission back to Earth yesterday, but will continue collecting data for eventual retrieval in the future. In January, something happened at the […]

title: Astrobotic eyes military customers for reusable Xogdor suborbital rocket
summary: The national security applications for a reusable suborbital rocket ‘haven't been fully explored’
